report.title: Withdrawal Difficulties
report.author: ub3rl4m3
report.bodytext: I took Effexor XR for diagnosed anxiety disorder & depression. Last spring, I decided to quit since I had few refills left and still had some serious depression-related problems (low self-worth, self-injury, no motivation, anhedonia). I tried quitting altogether & I felt horrible: hot flashes, feeling my pulse in my eyes when I moved them from side to side (rx information lists Effexor can affect pressure within the eye), disorientation, and general malaise. /n /n About a year later, I went to a dr. who told me some people who quit outright have been hospitalized with high body temperatures & other withdrawal-related complications. She gave me an Effexor XR starter pack with which to wean myself off the drug. Of the 2 weeks I went from taking 150mg/day to 75mg/day, I spent at least an entire week with the same miserable withdrawal symptoms, especially eye pulses & malaise only made better by lying still. The symptoms mostly disappeared while taking 37.5mg/day. /n /n Unless a person cannot take or has not had success with other medications for depression/anxiety problems (Zoloft, Prozac, etc), I do not recommend Effexor XR. /n /n If they are on it & wish to quit, they shouldn't quit abruptly.
